definition: to claim credit for oneself
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)
satisfied with one's accomplishment and arrogant as a result (idiom); resting on one's laurels and despising others

sentences.english: He often plumes himself on his accomplishment.
If London really is the capital of cool then Notting Hill is largely to blame.
sentences.chinese: 如果说伦敦是世界时尚之都，诺丁山可谓居功至伟。

sentences.english: Six Englishes with you white house, take the honor no small.
sentences.chinese: 陆英与你们白家，居功不小。

sentences.english: This isn't something that we can claim credit for.
sentences.chinese: 这并非我们可以居功的事情。

sentences.english: Chief Executive Tony Hsieh credits much of the company's success to its employees.
sentences.chinese: 在雇员们看来，董事长谢家华对公司的成功居功至伟。

definition: to claim credit for other people's achievements (idiom)
how could one dare?/I don't deserve such praise
satisfied with one's accomplishment and arrogant as a result (idiom); resting on one's laurels and despising others
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
modest/self-deprecating
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
great merit/great service
lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.
to show off one's accomplishments (often derog.)
to boast
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
untalented/I/me (humble)
to get undeserved rewards (idiom)
trivial matter/trifle
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
